doc.previous: where the wave vectors are related to the energy via
doc.after: with coefficients A and B determined from the boundary conditions and by imposing a continuous derivative on the solution  Each term of the solution can be interpreted as an incident reflected or transmitted component of the wave allowing the calculation of transmission and reflection coefficients Notably in contrast to classical mechanics incident particles with energies greater than the potential step are partially reflected
